description: MCP Server Configuration for MyManus Plugin in Claude Code
note: Add these MCP servers to your Claude Code configuration to enable MyManus capabilities

playwright.description: Browser automation for web research and complex interactions
notes: Required for complex web interactions (clicking, forms, navigation)
On Linux/WSL2, ensure DISPLAY variable is set appropriately
On Windows/macOS, remove the env section or adjust as needed

platform_specific.linux: Ensure X server is running and DISPLAY=:0 is set
platform_specific.wsl2: Install X server (VcXsrv/X410) and set DISPLAY variable
platform_specific.macos: Remove env section or set DISPLAY if using XQuartz

filesystem.description: Sandboxed filesystem access (optional - Claude Code has built-in file tools)
notes: Only needed if you want to restrict Claude Code to a specific directory
Claude Code already has Read, Write, Edit tools for filesystem operations
Replace /path/to/sandbox/directory with your desired sandbox path

shell.description: Sandboxed shell access (optional - Claude Code has built-in Bash tool)
notes: Only needed if you want sandboxed shell execution
Claude Code already has a Bash tool for command execution
Requires Python's uv/uvx to be installed

claude_code_mcp_setup: 2. Navigate to MCP Servers configuration section
3. Add the 'playwright' server configuration from above
5. Verify the Playwright MCP server appears in available tools
alternative_setup: If Claude Code doesn't have MCP UI configuration:
2. Edit the MCP configuration file (usually in .config/claude-code/)
3. Add server configurations to the mcpServers section

steps: 2. Check available tools/servers in the interface
4. Test browser automation with a simple command
5. Verify the browser launches and navigates correctly
